payout.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a large payment of money to someone, for example from an insurance claim or from winning a competition
payout.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: There should be a big payout on this month’s lottery.
Some of the victims have been offered massive cash payouts.
payout.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a large sum of money, given to someone for the work they have done
payout.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: an increase in commission payouts for some top-producing brokers
payout.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a payment made to someone who has made an insurance claim
payout.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The insurance company’s profits fell 13% because of big payouts related to a series of hurricanes.
payout.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a DIVIDEND payment (=part of a company’s profits for a particular period of time paid to people who own shares in it)
payout.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The board voted to cut the payouts in response to current operating results.
